params.description: Is a string containing the CityHack description
params.from: (indexed) Contains the address of the wallet that made effective the transaction
params.id: (indexed) Contains the id of the CityHack
params.timestamp: Contains the timestamp of the transaction

params._inadecuate: Is a boolean indicating if the CityHack is being reported/unreported
params.from: (indexed) Contains the address of the wallet that made effective the transaction
params.id: (indexed) Contains the id of the CityHack
params.latestReportNumber: (indexed) Contains the number of trust report
params.reportedHacks: Contains all the CityHack ids that are currently reported. Must contain as well the id of the current CityHack in case of inadecuated report
params.timestamp: Contains the timestamp of the transaction

params._voteResult: Is a boolean indicating if the vote it's voteResult or negative
params.from: (indexed) Contains the address of the wallet that made effective the transaction
params.hackId: (indexed) Contains the id of the CityHack

hideAndUnreportHack(uint256,uint256[]).details: This function is reserved to the owner of the contractThis function uses unreportHack function above and hideHack function below

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack
params._reportedHacks: Contains the reported hacks to date (including the current one)

hideHack(uint256).details: This function is reserved to the owner of the contractThere's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding it

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

postHack(string,uint256,uint256).details: Parameter description must not be emptyParameter _cityId must be > 0Parameter _categoryId must be > 0Variable "_hackId" is currently the index of the CityHack in the arrayState variable "hacks" does not support element deletions because index is used as CityHack id

params._categoryId: Contains the category id of the CityHack
params._cityId: Contains the city id of the CityHack
params._description: Contains the text describing the CityHack

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

reportHack(uint256,uint256[]).details: The event for reporting and unreporting is the sameThe number of reported hacks is saved to prevent a difference of reported hacks greater than 1Is still possible to stuff the parameter with fake reported hacks, think of a solution to mitigate this possibilityThe variable latestReportNumber is used for event fetching optimizationThere's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding it

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack
params._reportedHacks: Contains the reported hacks to date (including the current one)

tipHacker(uint256).details: There's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding it

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unHideHack(uint256).details: This function is reserved to the owner of the contractThere's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding it

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack

unreportHack(uint256,uint256[]).details: This function is reserved to the owner of the contractThe event for reporting and unreporting is the sameThe number of reported hacks is saved to prevent a difference of reported hacks greater than 1The variable latestReportNumber is used for event fetching optimizationThere's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding it

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack
params._reportedHacks: Contains the reported hacks to date (including the current one)

voteHack(uint256,bool).details: Owner of the hack cannot vote to himselfA _newVoteResult with the same contents as voteResult is not allowedThere's no option to withdraw a vote, only to change itThere's no validation that the hack id exists, consider adding itNested if/else may be confusing to read, consider a refactor

params._hackId: Contains the id of the CityHack
params._newVoteResult: Contains the new result of the vote

hacks.details: "hacks" does not support deleting elements from the array because index is used for CityHack id

NewHack(address,uint256,string,uint256).notice: Event indicates that a new CityHack has been created

TrustReport(address,uint256,bool,uint256.notice: Event indicates that a CityHack has been reported or unreported

VotedHack(address,uint256,bool,uint256).notice: Event indicates that a CityHack has been voted
